Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: travelhappycalif
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the front desk staff. They were very helpful while answering all of our questions as first time visitors to Paris. They sent us on our way each morning with big smiles and greeted us at the end of the day, inquiring how our day went. Our room was lovely with a bit of a view, though we weren't there much. So much to see in Paris! Bed was comfy and we loved the tiny little elevator...big enough for two people and a suitcase or two! Very glad we used tripadvisor to help us pick out this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing time”
Reviews.Author: amymadd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 13-15th Jan 2012. It is just up the road from Alma-Marceau station and a short walk from the Champs-Élysées so very well located. The staff are very friendly and will help you with anything you need, they directed us to all the major attractions and gave us a little map to help us find our way back. We had a basic room and it was lovely, the bed was comfy and the bathroom spotless. The room came with a fully stocked mini bar that was pricey, 5.5 euro for a small bag of m&ms no thank you! We decided to go out for breakfast so cannot comment on the quality of the food however it did look very nice both mornings with a large selection of fruit and pastries but at 28 euros each a bit out of our price range. Overall a wonderful stay and would go back again at the right price, we got this hotel as part of a package deal so it only cost us £100 a night absolute bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel, Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sean B
Reviews.Content: My now fiancee and I stayed here for three nights in January 2012. The location is ideal for first time visitors to Paris, which we were. The staff was very professional, and capable. Very friendly as well. Even the obnoxious American family I witnessed behaving like ignorant morons were treated with more respect than I would have given them (I myself am American). Meila was very clean, well decorated, and a pleasure to stay at. When we return to Paris, it will definitely be considered again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Comfy Bed, Great Price, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: tftjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the week of Christmas 2011. The hotel is located in the Pont de l'Alma/Champs Elysèes area which is an excellent neighborhood. The Avenue Montaigne is the next street over and is probably more glamorous of a shopping address than Rodeo Drive. The Champs Elysèes is about 5 minutes away and you can virtually see the Eiffel Tower from the hotel. The service was excellent. I heard them speak English, Spanish, Italian and French while we were there. The room is small but that is to be expected of any major international city. You should only be sleeping and showering in there anyways. The bathroom was nice and clean with a warm shower and the bed was very comfortable after a long day of exploring the city. There are a few cafes in the area but not a ton of restaurants so go towards Champs Elysèes or across the bridge to the Champs-deMars area which is where we went and found some great local French restaurants. To get to the hotel from CDG airport Terminal 2 via the metro follow the signs for the RER (Paris by Train) in the airport to the main station. In the main station go to the glass room that says 'Billet lle-de-France' (Tickets Paris). They have service people that speak English and ask for your roundtrip tickets on the RER to Pont del'Alma. They should cost about €14 per person round trip. (You can also purchase a visitor pass to ride any train, any time for about €50 a person). Take the RER B to the Saint-Michel station and then switch to the RER C and get off at the Pont de I'Alma‎ station. The hotel is about 300 meters (5 min walk) from the train station. Overall a great place and recommended by a frequent European traveler. If you can get a great price then stay there. We paid €160 a night which was about €70 less then everything near it at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lankk97
Reviews.Content: We reached the hotel exhausted because we had to carry our heavy luggage up and down the stairs at the Paris metro (No escalators at most of the metro stations!!!). The nearest station is Alma Merceau. You get a nice view of the Eiffel Tower when you come out of the station! The hotel is a short walk away in a very quiet street. The girl at the reception (i think her name was Maria) was very nice and welcoming. She gave us a map and explained how to get around Paris when she found out that it was our first time there. Since our room did not come with breakfast, she suggested I join as a Melia member so we can get the 2nd person breakfast at 50% off. The elevator to the room is tiny but the room is of decent size. Breakfast was ok. the waiters are polite but not as pleasant as Maria. While the road outside is very quiet, it appeared safe, at least nothing happen to us when we came back around 10pm the 3 nites we were there. We like the hotel, it's nice, cosy. The staff are generally very nice, It is also very near to the Champs Elysee. Will definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but so hot”
Reviews.Author: JessRLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of October this year. The hotel location is really great and the room, lobby, staff etc were all very nice. Unfortunately the room was so hot though. I asked at the reception desk if they could turn down the heat but they explained that all rooms are on the same system and that they couldn't make any changes. It was pretty mild whilst we were there so the first night we had the window open but we were bitten alive by mosquitos! So we ended up hardly spending any time in the room - apart from sleeping. It's a real shame because the hotel was otherwise perfect for a little break in Paris. And the staff were really lovely and helpful. But it really was uncomfortably hot in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bish_and_Dockers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during October but were so busy exploring Paris that it literally was a bed for the night, a shower for the morning and little else. That said the receptionists were very helpful and the room while not enormous was clean and nicely decorated. On the downside the walls of the rooms are very thin and the room was quite hot. Locationwise its in a great spot close to a metro station and central enough that if you want to walk you can easily get to most of the major sights on foot, its also very close to lots of restaurants and bars. If we came to Paris again I would definately look up this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfy”
Reviews.Author: SerenaMorena
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - from who doesnt know Paris is just around the corner of Av de Montaigne, the super posh luxury street in Paris, Amazing view from the street of the Eiffel Tower, very close to major actractions - Champs Elysee, Petit Palais, Place concorde, etc etc Really nice breakfast as usual, with the Spanish touch that always the Melia chain gives to the customers. My bed really made me feel like a princess. The bathtube was really too small to get in - however in any parisienne hotel you'll find the rooms to be too small compared to other location around the world.. No free Wifi in rooms or lobby. If you don't have a laptop and you still need to check your email or info on the net, the staff will propose you to use the notebook from the hotel and carry it on your room for a few hours! Excellent staff - everybody has been really nice, helpful and very professional. I LOVed staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay........great location.............”
Reviews.Author: Kuzuri
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2011 on a family vacation. The rooms are small, but that was not a problem for us. We had two rooms for two adults and one teenager. We spent very little time in the room, so the size was not an issue. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. (We actually moved here from another hotel that was substandard.) We ordered room service one night. It was acceptable......not great, but acceptable. Other than that time, we did not eat at the hotel. We loved the location. There are several good restaurant options and historic sites in walking distance (if you enjoy long walks), and the shopping was fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you can have a better choice, avoid absolutely that hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edwardh2g
Reviews.Content: Paris is very often a busy city. We had to choose that hotel among 2 other 4 / 5 stars offered. Price was reasonable for location (near Avenue Montaigne) BUT you have to know that rooms are small, decoration is really kitch and below any acceptable level for any international traveller, very dusty (if you are allergic, consider twice !!!), AND : AC out of order in our room, huge noise of outside AC units (but not our apparently ....) and most of all armies of well organised very hungry tropical mosquitoes .... What a night !!!! Believe me, just an overnight fighting against mosquitoes. Also the walls between rooms are thin, so you can participate by procurement to intime games of your young and sexy neighbours. Need a real refresh and a new strategy to consider hotel business !!

Reviews.Title: “Not good first impression”
Reviews.Author: Pickytraveler2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on a business trip, as it is conveniently located near business offices. Was not informed about hotel rate agreement with local business, so rate charged was 100 euros per night higher than expected. Was told that breakfast was included in room rate ( it was not). Room was not ready when arrived so waited almost 2 hours on lobby for "priority" cleaning of room. After 3rd inquiry, they "found" a room. Room itself was ok, not great. Threadbare carpet, cracked and loose floor tiles in bathroom. Breakfast was pretty meager for 28 euros (ok, so it is Paris, but still). This was my first stay and as they say, you only get one chance to make a first impression. On the positive side, wired Internet in the room was free and fast. And, the location is ideal - for either business or pleasure. Might try it again if I could get the rate associated with the local business, if not, I suggest trying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the location & the staff!”
Reviews.Author: revitalize10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, it's right around the corner from the Champs-Elysses (shopping!!!), some great restaurants and a great view of the Eiffel tour. It's also a short walk from the Louvre and Eiffel tower (both about 20 minutes in opposite directions). The staff at this hotel were incredibly helpful and friendly. They were constantly checking in with is when we arrived back to the hotel and they were extremely courteous in helping us get information about one of our tours. They also offered some great restaurant recommendations. Our rooms were clean and comfortable. Of all the beds we slept in during this trip (we visited Rome and Capri prior to arriving in Paris) this was the most comfortable bed (3 on a scale of 5). The air conditioning didn't get as cold as my husband normally likes it, but I was satisfied. If you join the hotel loyalty program, breakfast is buy one get one free. We took advantage of this after scoping out the menu selection the first morning. Again, out of the hotels we stayed in prior to Paris, this hotel had the best breakfast- a variety to choose from and the quality was above average. (It was also most like our "American" breakfast hotels with eggs, meats, etc. Their croissants were better than the ones in the US though!) Overall, this hotel was excellent. It was a great place to end our trip and I would definitely stay at a Melia Boutique hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelhooper99
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel and was told my room had been sold, had to travel a couple miles to another hotel, checked in and my room was a double not twin as requested, when i asked to be moved i was told there was nothing that could be done, my college slept on a sofa for the first night and paid 4star prices to do so, not compensated at all for the hotels mistakes, charged full rates on check out, lesson learnt, this melia hotel is second rate and would be compared to a uk Travelodge, the location was fair although melia made the decision on which district i stayed in, not the trip i planned to have and possibly my worst hotel experience ever, I WILL NEVER STEP FOOT IN A MELIA HOTEL EVER AGAIN AND I RECOMMEND THE SAME TO ANYONE ELSE

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located small hotel”
Reviews.Author: g4480
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night here but found it conveniently located. The staff were very helpful when I asked for help finding an electronics store to get an adaptor I left home. They seem to all speak Spanish, French and English. The room was very comfortable and larger than I expected. Nicely appointed and clean. Very quiet. Hardwired Internet was supposedly available in the room through but I couldn't get it to work. Front desk staff couldn't help and referred me to a outside number to provide service but I didn't bother. Seemed like a lot of trouble to get connected. No Wifi available.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Calling_In_Sick
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. The hotel is small and very cute. The staff was incredibly helpful in making restaurant and transportation recommendations and were always friendly and cheerful. In the lobby there was always mint infused water and lemon water, perfectly refreshing when returning from a full day of activities. The room good size for the 2 of us, with a queen bed, flatscreen tv, mini-fridge, desk, 2 chairs. The bedroom itself was closed off from the entrance where the closet was located and seperated by a 2nd door to block out any hallway noise. We did not experience any noise whatsoever as others have mentioned. My only small complaint would be that high speed internet was expensive (I think 15-20 Euro???) but we managed to link onto another network so was not an issue. The location was perfect since it was in a residential side street while only 2 blocks away from Champs Elysee. Less than a block walk was a cafe with a great view of the Eiffel Tower at night. The hotel is also close to 2 Metro stations and 1 RER station so getting around via public transportation was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Shame they didn't have the air con turned on!”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthGirl
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel, great location as previous reviewers have said. The downside for us was how hot the room was, we arrived on Easter Monday when it was 29 degrees and asked in the evening about air con as we couldn't get it to work and were told that 'it wasn't turned on at this time of year' we had 3 nights of broken sleep due to the heat. We weren't happy about leaving the windows open as they opened onto a terrace which anyone from the rooms on that floor could in theory access your room. I know unlikely but I wouldn't have been able to sleep knowing that. I hate to be negative about this aspect of our stay so if air con is important to you check in advance if it is the right time of year for it to be working. Hotel was easy to get to from Charles DG airport, Blue line to Notre Dame on the RER and then change to yellow line to Pont D'Alma then 5 mins walk. Lots of great restaurants nearby with views of the tower which is so pretty in the evening. We had a great couple of days in Paris which was helped by the central location of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Only Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lotawana
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 3 night stay at this wonderful hotel. I searched and searched many hotels on Trip Advisor and ended up with this one. I highly recommend this excellent hotel for service, price, location, and friendliness of staff. The room was awesome and had a partial view of the Eiffel Tower. You walk out your door and within 100 yards you are on the Seine and a great view. The location is in the most fashionable part of Paris. If you are looking to be in the Latin Quarter right out your door this is not the place but you can get there in 5-10 minutes by taxi. You can also use the VeLib bikes (highly recommend). We absolutely loved this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat. If you are looking for boutique and within price reasonability and excellent, modern yet stylish decor, this is the place for you. After 3 hours of searching online, I can say it was well worth the time to find. Go for it! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vboyz103
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on our recent trip to tour Europe. I arrived and checked in, as expected, the room is smaller than an average American hotel, but that's just the standard size in most part of Europe. The space is good enough for a couple in a single-queen size bed. The room was clean and neat when we checked in. What I really liked about this hotel is the staff was extremely helpful given that this is my first trip to Europe. Pablo was the guy that was super helpful, I asked him lots about places and how to get there. He took time and explained everything to me. The other staff were very friendly and to be honest, this is the best hotel experience throughout my entire trip compared to hotels I stayed in Rome, Venice, and Barcelona. The room services can be quite expensive though, so you just have to ask about the price for every service you want if you don't like surprises like I do. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who's visiting Paris. The hotel is very conveniently located in Paris where access to Metro (train) station just a few minutes walk. The Metro is very helpful to hop on-off between attractions and great way to save some $$, and DO NOT ever take the taxi because they are so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mercyme8888
Reviews.Content: I can not express how wonderful, pleasant, caring, sincere, knowlegable and kind the staff at Melia Royal Alma is. My mom and I stayed there for 6 days and the staff assisted us with where to go first, how to get there, what to look for, even walked us out to the bus station and the metro!!!! Our room was very French. Very cute and immaculate. The hotel is just a few steps away from the bus station, metro and 10 minutes to the Eiffel Tower. There is a cafe around the corner with a full view of the Eiffel Tower. Great place to have a cup of tea and look out to the Eiffel in the evening. FYI...every hour from 8pm till 12 midnight, the Eiffel sparkles for 10 mins. Its soooo pretty. If you are planning to go to Paris, this is the hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel, fantastic breakfast, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: dubrov13
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in the hotel for 2 nights Dec 28-29. The staff is well versed in English, the hotel is super close to major attractions, the room was a bit small but very clean. The best thing the hotel had going was the continental breakfast. Exceptionally good, wide variety, open 7-10:30 am. The only negative I had was our neighbors were up each morning before 5am and we could hear their every word. They were not making attempts to be quiet, but perhaps the age of the hotel aided to the problem as we felt we were in their bedroom with them. Outside of that, very nice, would stay there again, and perhaps try a different room than #204.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location & shopping!!!”
Reviews.Author: jacquie_baby
Reviews.Content: Fabulous stay at theis lovely quaint hotel. great value for money & fabulous staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anta_Toronto
Reviews.Content: Just back from Paris (23-26Dec). We picked this hotel through our timeshare system. Location is great. Don't forget to buy museum pass and metro pass before you will arrive to Paris, it keeps you out of lines to museum and make easy transportation to any point. Hotel is clean, very quiet location. Service is great, very polite staff. We had living room for our teenager son and separate room for us, 2 toilets and shower, TV was in each room, beatiful furniture, small balcony. JUNIOR SUITE.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nicely appointed rooms, excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: TandCfromHawaii
Reviews.Content: I loved this boutique hotel! I was looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in Paris and got this spectacular hotel. It is easily within walking distance to the Champs Elysees, the Arc de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower, the Grand Palais and two subway lines which easily took us to the other areas of Paris and Versailles. It is on a quiet side street so we missed a lot of the traffic people tend to complain about in other areas. There are some nice restaurants easily within walking distance, but not as many cafes as I had hoped. The hotel staff was extremely pleasant, accommodating and helpful. No rudeness at all here! The staff easily spoke English, French, German and Italian. I did not eat the breakfast at the hotel since it was very expensive buffet and I just don't eat that much, but they did offer a 50% discount for those who signed up for their frequent user membership. Towels were nice and fluffy, the bed was firm, but the comforters were fluffy and comfy and warm.

Reviews.Title: “A classic standard!”
Reviews.Author: ophilos
Reviews.Content: I am visiting this hotel the last 7 years and during all my visits I never had a complaint from the staff, the services, the cleanliness, the quality of the food every time I had to order something in my room while working.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: AcDcToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Melia Royal Alma Boutique Hotel in Paris and it was perfect for us. The location, cleanliness, service, breakfast and would definitely not look around next time but would go straight back to Melia. By applying to their Melia points card, you can save money on their breakfast which is regularly 28 euros but with the card is two for 28, which is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It was much better. It is regressing.”
Reviews.Author: Rahayel
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel twice in 4 years. Unfortunately everything is regressing. The service was much better, the rooms were cleaner, the room service and amenities were better and the hotel is becoming too old without any renovation. It is a great boutique hotel, in the heart of Paris, 5 minutes from the champs élysées, in a calm neighbourhood where you can always find a place to park. The first time, I visited this hotel, I was really happy. The chocolate on the bed, the towel on the floor, the bathrobe, the slippers, were small things that made me come again: all those have disappeared for 2010. The breakfast is nice, purely French and fine. The lobby: old, dirty couches. A couple of thousands should be spent on this hotel before it looses all it's clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with big rooms”
Reviews.Author: sailgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Royal Alma for one night in September, and selected it primarily due to its proximity to the Theatre Champs Elysees, where we were attending a concert. This hotel is a little gem! Extremely warm and helpful front desk, staffed by Spaniards with excellent multi-lingual skills. Everything faultlessly clean, sparkling bathroom with great shower, lighted make-up mirror, decent hair-drying and lovely shampoos & soaps. Having stayed in Paris on numerous occasions, I was happily surprised by the room size. The hotel is on a very quiet street, yet close to everything. Our room had two small balconies with top-to-bottom views of the nearby Eiffel Tower. The bed was extremely comfortable,with wonderful pillows - we slept like babies. Had a very early train in the morning, so skipped the breakfast but a peek into the breakfast room looked nice. We plan to stay at this hotel again, hopefully when we have more time to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and overall clean and spacious (for Paris) rooms!”
Reviews.Author: KandPBobble
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at the Melia Royal Alma hotel and had a enjoyable stay. The main plus of the hotel is the location, you can walk to the Eiffel Tower in 15 minutes or so, the Champs Elysees in less than 10 minutes and the Arc De Triomphe in 15 minutes. The hotel rooms are clean though a little worn in places and the room size is not bad for Paris. Anytime we needed help on reception the staff were very friendly and useful. When you walked through the hotel most of the staff would say hello which was nice too. Overall if you are only in Paris for a short time and looking for a location close to the main sights then you can't really go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I returned from Paris last night, and...”
Reviews.Author: J94
Reviews.Content: I returned from Paris last night, and very much enjoyed my stay at this hotel! I took the metro from the Gare du Nord to the hotel and immediately after exiting the station immediately saw the Eiffel Tower, making me feel like I was right in the heart of Paris and ready for a lovely trip!! Upon arrival everything was organized for us and our room was ready for us even though we were checking in early. Our room was nice. Fairly large. The bathroom was nice and clean!! Beds were comfy, pillows were a bit on the squishy side but it didn't bother me!! The location is what you pay for! Minutes walk to the champs-élysées, right by the river Seine, Eiffel Tower in sight, but the hotel is located on a quiet road!! The shops nearby are lovely, Dior, Chanel, Gucci etc etc Our first night we wanted to eat locally and found a nice restaurant ( I think it was called les Coastes ). Overall, I would definately recommend this hotel - it is 4 star - but it exceeded my expectations and I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Zuoz
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel very much . During my business trips to Paris I stayed only in this hotel, becouse of very central location( but not loud!) , price is ok for this location , people on reception are very helpfull(usually)), breakfast is very good. In fact this is very good small 4 stars level city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay, great service, large room by Paris standards, new bathroom, with Grohe fixtrures, great locatio”
Reviews.Author: ell4jan
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough good things about this hotel. From the concierge Michelle who treated us with marvelous service to the bellhops, chamber maids. kitchen staff, we were treated with deferince and respect. Although older, it was well maintained, clean, with comfortable appointments. Room was large by Paris standards, spacious bathroom with new fixtures, fresh towels, etc. every day. Location was one block from the Siene, with great view of the Eifel Tower, 15 minute walk to the Champ-Ellysee. Wonderful restaurants, and chiique upscale business trravel and shopping area. Would highly recommend and will return. Love Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb position and that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: kingdom100
Reviews.Content: As every other reviewer has noted, this property's position just off of Avenue Montaigne is extremely convenient for just about everywhere you want to travel in central Paris. When I arrived at the hotel, the doorman held the swing door open for me, rather than take my luggage from me which was bizarre. The reception staff were efficent enough, but not particularly welcoming. The first room I was allocated was compact, and the bathroom arranged in such a way that one had to do gymnastics to exit the bath/shower without brushing up against the loo. I am not one who normally complains about hotel beds being too hard, but this one was virtually indistinguishable from sleeping on the floor, also it was made up with blankets rather than a duvet which is something I haven’t seen for many years. When I called housekeeping, they advised that they did not have duvets in any rooms so could not assist. Around 11pm when trying to sleep, I could hear a conversation from the neighbouring room, eventually I managed to get to sleep, only to be woken up at 2.30am by the neighbour having a telephone conversation. What I must stress is that this individual was talking at normal volumes, so the problem lies purely with thin, poorly insulated walls between rooms. At 11pm I had called down and the receptionist advised that they will ask the neighbouring individual to stop their conversation, I told them that that was ridiculous as it was not as if they were shouting! The next day I complained and was upgraded to a “superior” room which only had a neighbour on one side and proved to be quieter. Also, this room was made up with a duvet, despite my having been told previously that they only had blankets! Something to note about both rooms is the extremely loud air-conditioning fan noise, there is no way one would be able to sleep with the air-con on. The bar area always closed early, before 10pm each evening, and the “restaurant” was solely a breakfast room. Room service seemed to be non-existent as no menu was placed in the rooms. Quite how this hotel is rated four star when there is no restaurant baffles me. A nice touch was the provision of two carafes of water made freely available in the lobby, one “scented” with lemon, the other with mint. This is something that reminds me of Ritz-Carlton style service, although, this was the only thing there that did! I booked this hotel using a “secret” type web-site so paid 60% less than the very best available rate at the time of booking. If you can secure this property for less than circa EUR120 per night then it provides a very central base in Paris, otherwise you can do far better for your money. It is a Spanish chain and there were lots of Spanish coach parties staying there, so I am sure no one is paying published rates.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everywhere... what a location”
Reviews.Author: Amirhossein79
Reviews.Content: What a location for this 4 star hotel... Located in la rue Jean Goujon, 2 minutes walk to the bridge of Alma, 7 minutes to Eiffel Tower, 5 minutes to Champs-Elysee and 15 minutes to place de la Concorde and eventually 30 minutes walk to musée du Louvre. One day I did all of these walking just to provide accurate timing. The incredible staff who are friendly and helpful. This hotel would be my first and last option in beautiful Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dixonlj3
Reviews.Content: Great central location for exploring Paris, with very friendly and helpful hotel staff who on finding out it was our anniversary gave us a complementary half bottle of champagne. Lovely reception area, rooms small but no smaller than other hotels in Paris. Nicely decorated and very clean. Overall would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good, the second time around!”
Reviews.Author: BartsBoss
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Melia Royal Alma and I must say it was as good or better than the first one last year. The staff continues to be a true highlight of this hotel. Even though it is a smaller boutique hotel, the service could not be better. Everyone appeared to have a sincere smile on his/her face and nothing appeared to much to ask. The accommodations were very comfortable and the new beds were excellent. This continues to be a real hidden gem in a great location. I cannot wait to return next time.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: CanSunSeeker
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location! Ave Jean Gougeon is one block south of Ave Montaigne The poshest street in Paris. A couple blocks south of Champ Elysees. Mins walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre. One block from the subway station. Excellent restaurants in the area. Room was spacious. However the bed was incredibly hard! and well it's the only thing I found wrong with the room. Clean..... French style. The window opens up into a court yard. Very Quiet. Staff and service was great. a Good 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, nice location - needs a rennovation”
Reviews.Author: specialk23
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to Paris, choosing normally to stay in opera district. Booked this through priceline on a great deal but was a little unsure about what I was getting into. Overall I was not dissppointed The location is very nice. Quite suburban street. Walk 50m and you get a full frontal eiffel tower postcard image - really beautiful. The room was HUGE for paris and bathroom was also large. Internet was free which is not standard for Paris. However I did feel that room decor felt very tired. My desk chair was broken. Shower head was old and flaky. Lighting was very poor. However overall, for the price I paid (around 125E) it was "good value". Breakfast was a frightening 28E. Restaurants in the area are fairly sparse. There are a handful of restaurants near metro station 100m away but they were quite fancy.

Reviews.Title: “If you`ve never been to paris, great place to stay, Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: missbrookes
Reviews.Content: Never been to paris, this hotel could not be in a better position. Eiffel tower at the end of the road, champs elise round the corner. Bikes to rent at the end of the road too. stunning room. Friendly staff pointed out the great sites. great stay, have recommended it, but do shop around for the price as can be quiet expensive if you book at the wrong places.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Staff and Price Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Maginot26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meliá Royal Alma Boutique Hotel on the 13th June for a planned proposal. On checking in we were given room 602 which was very large (led to believe that parisian hotel rooms are very small), seperate toilet and very nice bathroom with powerful shower (also bath can be filled quickly). Staff were so friendly and give you a map of the area on arrival showing you were you are and how to get to attractions. The hotel is only 15minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower, or other direction to the Arc de Triomphe. I was planning on proposing to my girlfriend and asked reception if I could have rose petals, champagne and a gold rose that i had brought with me put in my room for my return. This was fine and on returning at midnight the champagne was in a bucket with ice, glasses by the side and roses all over the bed (won me lots of brownie points). Checkout was a good time of 12pm, so had time to rest and pack (although left lots of rose petals behind). i didn't have the breakfast or anything from minibar as a little expensive. I would definitely recommend this hotel though as loation is excellent along with prices for that area. The only issue I had was parking is on George V that charges 29 euros for 24hours so bit pricey if staying a few days and on last minute website the hotel is listed as being on rue goujon, when it is actually rue jean goujon. Took a while to find it with the sat nav!!! All in all an excellent stay and will hoping to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a great location with great staff”
Reviews.Author: olive13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a long weekend in Paris.I found this hotel on trip advisor and have no complaints.The location is wonderful and the staff were so helpful.Ben deserves special mention as he sent us to some great restaurants and was great fun.I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.It's close to the Champs Elysee, the Eiffel tower, the River Seine and lots of other great attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: tanprworld
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2nt break at this hotel and wish we could have stayed longer! Great location, close by to metro station and rer line. At the end of the street is the Seine and you have great views of the Eiffel tower! Hotel staff very friendly with great service and informative about the city. The breakfast was great, loads of choice and very fresh food. The rooms were nicely decorated, if I could say one bad thing it would be that the beds were hard but that is just being very picky! You dont go to Paris to spend your day in bed!!!!! The hotel is in the fashion district and is not for doing Paris on a budget, but it was well worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shez_000
Reviews.Content: Very well situated hotel, right between the Eiffel Tower and Champs-Elysee, and two mins from the nearest metro station. The hotel itself is beautiful, very luxurious, staff are very friendly. Only drawback is that room wasnt the biggest and not very well lit, but aparently most parisian rooms are small! Bathroom is awesome, very luxurious and clean. Overall, i would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A real find!!!”
Reviews.Author: JillyMcWilly
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that finding a hotel in Paris is quite a task! There are a ton of hotels, most are pricey, and it's hard to know what area is the best area in which to stay. I did MAJOR research and found this little nugget! I chose it because it is in a great location and it is reasonably priced by Paris standards. I stayed at the Melia in the summer of 2007. My husband and I treated his family to the trip so we had three rooms. I wanted a reasonably priced hotel in a great location, and that is exactly what I got! The hotel is a VERY SHORT walk from the Champs Elysees, Avenue Montagne, and the Eiffel Tower. Rue Jean Goujon literally backs up to the river so we walked right down our first night and did the river cruise. That was AMAZING, all of the main attractions were lit up at night. The rooms are no frills but comfortable. The lobby is great, with couches for lounging and hanging out. There is a small bar too, and you can get an expresso or a cocktail throughout the day. The breakfast is expensive and pretty unremarkable. However, it was still nice to have a meal and then go out for the day without worrying about finding a bite to eat. There are a number of cafes and fresh produce markets around as well. I'm a weird eater so I usually stick to simple eating when i'm abroad. It's easy to get a cheese and tomato baguette at a cafe here or a margherita pizza. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower early in the morning ( go about an hour before it opens and you'll be in and out before the lines start) and then you can hop on the double decker bus right in front of the tower in order to hit The Louvre etc. GREAT hotel! I'm telling you, it's a hidden gem. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Boring”
Reviews.Author: lukozone
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel between Christmas and New Year and have to tell you for the money they are charging it's poor. Very poor actually bearing in mind that while staying in the Junior Suite the bed was missing pillows. Finally got given one with sheet that wouldn't match pillow because they run out. They also did not have twin bed available as they presumed two people with the same name would be couple. Location wise it's not that great either. Although overlooking Seine, Tower etc there's nothing going on around except two really overpriced resturants. There are many hotels in Paris and most of them have charm that is not there in Royal Alma. As per Boutique ... I don't really understand it. There's nothing orginal and different about it. Small rooms, lifts that hardly fit two people and zero facilities. Think twice before you book it. You could do so much better with your money, Love Paris. Not so much Royal Alma.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first time Paris goers”
Reviews.Author: ijdwright
Reviews.Content: Absolutely first class service from everyone at the hotel. The room was very warm and on the small side however this certainly did not detract from the excellent overall feel of the hotel. For first time visitors (or people who like to be close to the Champs-elysee) this was great. 300 meters from the excellent metro service and 15 minutes walk to the CE and Eieffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sails57
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Melia Royal Alma Hotel for three nights in May 2008. We found the hotel to be exceptionally clean, and the staff to be out-of-their-way kind and friendly. They were helpful in every way to make our stay a pleasant one. Yes, the rooms are on the small side. This is Paris. However, they are quiet, restful, and very well appointed. The bathroom was spotless, and all toiletries were offered. There was an abundance of towels. Breakfast was extraordinary for such a small hotel. A vast assortment of fruits, cereals, and pastries were available, as well as hot foods. Our waitress helped us with our elementary French, and we all had a good laugh. Water, infused with mint leaves, was available daily in the lobby. My daughter and I were glad to have such a pleasant room, and hotel atmosphere awaiting us at the end of a long day of sight-seeing. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: After we went to Disneyland Paris, we wanted to stay a few nights in the city centre of Paris as well. I am really so glad we choose this hotel. The location is absolutely perfect. If you walk out of the hotel and look to your left, you can directly see the Eiffel Tower. Lots of nice restaurants and terraces in the neighboorhood. Also just 10 minutes walking to world-famous Champs Elysees. The staff is really perfect and willing to do almost anything you need. Breakfast had lots of choice, and when they were out of something, you could ask and had it in 5 minutes. The rooms are really boutique/old french, with a modern bathroom. Room was also well cleaned every day! On my next trip to Paris definately this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay: discrete and elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruby024
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Melia Royal Alma Boutique Hotel two nights in early December (6th & 7th). The hotel it’s a discrete building beautiful situated between Place d'Alma and the Champs-Elysees. In one hand you have the top shops at Avenue Montaigne and, in the other, the art exhibitions of the Grand Palais or the auction houses as Christie’s and Arcurial and others galleries just some waking distance. The hotel rooms are not large but quite well decorated giving and comfortable and luxury touch. The staff it’s very nice and full of attentions to costumers ( especially at the breakfast room) . If you come late there’s always a small buffet table with coffee, tea, fruit as biscuits near the guests elevator, that very nice. I surely recommend this hotel to does who do not wish to stay in a large and impersonal hotel but prefer a discrete and elegant place.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrMelSwansea
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to this hotel from a sister hotel in another part of the city. We had 2 rooms, and both were well appointed and clean, one at the front and one at the rear, both quiet. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful (not always the case in France) and spoke good English and Spanish. Excellent showers and beds. We had room service a couple of times which was quite good value for money, particularly compared to the restaurants in the area. However, breakfast seemed pricey so we did not bother. This brings me to the best thing about the hotel, the location. It is a short (3 min.) walk to a metro, 10 min. to Champs d'Elysses and you get a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower from the end of the street. If you like designer shops (for window or actual shopping) then there are loads in the next street (Avenue Montaigne). I would recommend this hotel, though the rates would be quite high if you are on a budget (as we were) but as we were upgraded this did not apply to us. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: PJMM
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great location, close to the city core area, subways, etc. A nice quiet location, too...one of the better places we have stayed in our three prior visits to Paris. Excellent breakfast served in a delightful garden at the rear of the hotel. Rooms are well appointed and generally clean. Bathrooms are very clean. But we found a few 'dust bunnies' floating around in the closet. From a service perspective, bathroom amenities are not always replenished without asking. All this to suggest that some cleaning details are overlooked; not what one would have expected in a hotel of this class. Overall, a good boutique hotel in Paris and a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent Location & Room - One of Better Boutiques We've Stayed in (Long)”
Reviews.Author: NYC-3
Reviews.Content: I read the range of reviews on this hotel before we left with some trepidation -- having already had the reservations made by my wife's company's travel office. There seemed to be such a wide swing. So instead of providing a brief blurb, I thought I'd describe the pros and cons. PROS: First, this is neither the Four Seasons or the Plaza Athenee--nor does it try to be. (Although both are about 2-3 blocks away, which sort of gives you the idea, along with Prada, Loro Piana, etc., of the neighborhood.) It is a boutique hotel...small and intimate. We were there during the World Cup matches and quite a few people gathered before the large plasma TV in the first floor lounge (with a small but effective bar) to watch some games. It was like watching with a bunch of friends. and when people entering or leaving walked by through the lobby, they would stop, watch a few minutes, talk and then be on their way. There are rooms that face the small, quiet street, and some that look into an interior courtyard. We had a room with a King looking to the interior. It was remarkably quiet for being a block from Aves. George V and Montaigne. The birds chirping were the loudest thing we ever heard. The room was of good size for a small hotel. With the King, there was adequate walking room on both sides, and at the foot of the bed a small couch. Beyond that a writing desk, small table (good for eating room service) and an armoire with safe, tv, small refrig, and luggage stand. Plenty of room for two people. well lit, very good A/C with variable fan and lots of outlets. I like outlets. This was Room 307. The decor was French fancy with gilded mouldings and nice wallpaper. Three of the best items about the room were: (1) has REALLY thick, heavy doors which block all noise -- even between the room and bath. (2) Has an 'airlock' type of entry into the room. Heavy outside door with bolting lock, small hall before room with double closet with mirrors, and another big door into room. Superb sound control. (3) Hard bed. I hate mushy French beds. This one was, happily, firm -- and they had a pillow menu for American wimps like me. Bath had been redone in past couple of years so was largely new. Had Grohe fixtures, a marble inlaid floor and double sinks. Great pressure and lots of HW. They had a good hairdryer, and when asked brought an ironing board and iron which we kept the full time. It fit nicely under the bed. Since my wife was working every day and I was on vacation, I slept in and didn't leave until Noonish on some days. The maids were really great generally and especially about this! No knocking, no dirty looks for sxrewing up their schedules. I'd let them know I was going to be out for a bit, and the room would be ready as soon as I got back. Getting really good, consistent service for 8 days is worth a remark. The food and room service situation is a bit confusing in the written descriptions, so let me clear this up. The Hotel has a cute breakfast-only restaurant with an enclosed courtyard area--just off the main entrance hall as you walk through to the elevators. It serves until 10:30am. There is also room service from 6 am until 10:30 am. On several days we left the choice on the door handle and breakfast appeared within 8 minutes of the time indicated. The menu is not large, but it would serve for in-room meals as needed. The food was all very good. The breakfast is additional to the room charge and is fairly elaborate--25 Euros either in the restaurant or the room. On most days i just wandered up to the Champs and got some pasteries and OJ for 6-7 Euros. Hard to eat a big breakfast after a huge dinner at 10pm. Which brings up the location. It is about 8 blocks up along Ave. Montaigne to Rond Pont. It is right at the Alma Bridge (close to the Eiffel Tower) and a 1 minute walk to the Metro. Alma-Marceau. If you haven't been in Paris before this is a perfect location along the major tourist axis. You can walk to the Tower, Trocadero, and the Louvre. Its a bit touristy in the sense that many Americans are in this area--but it is definately upscale. We have a cousin that lives in Montparnasse, near the Gare, and that is more neighborhoodish.... The staff speak English but one or two not highly complex English. Certainly sufficient for 90% of complex issues, and willing to work with you. They were polite and helpful. But it is a small staff, and the entrance desk area is too small and can get overrun. You have to pass through it to get into the main lobby-lounge area and elevator. That having been said, they were nice to us and everything was efficient and accurate. CONS. First, when I call a hotel and ask if they have Internet Access, I should specify what type. They have a computer in the lobby that is broadband and costs 15 Euros for an hour of time. But no in-room WiFi. I'm told that this is still not unusual in Paris, but the choice of an expensive telephone dialup line and a single 15 Euros per hour computer does not do it for me. I hope they put in WiFi. (Moreover, the SFR WiFi card was almost useless -- not the hotel's fault, this was bought separately--as well. It was back to McDonalds where it was free, fast and there was a shake and some fries.) So it was a 10 miunte walk to use my computer at length--although I did buy 1 hour for quick email checks and that lasted the week, and that worked out well. Second, and this may just be me, they have a small room off the main desk area, for waiting I suppose. But they should move the Reception desk into there and make that initial entry area bigger. That room is beautiful, of good size and unused. I feel sorry for the poor managers--they are quite good, but that is not the best set-up. I believe the physical layout leads to a sense of there being more of a flurry than there really is. The closer setting is nice when entering and leaving when there are not things going on--or luggae coming or going--it is nicely intimate....but the trade-off suggests a revised floorplan. Third, like a lot of older French buildings that have been modernized, the elevator is small. 4 people would be tight. 2 people with bags. No way to change it, and my cousin's building has one about the same size for a much larger population. Fourth, I would have given up the space given to the nice luggage stand in exchange for a few extra drawers, although it was adequate. Also, there were a few minor dings to the wallpaper and such that could be fixed in about 20 minutes--might as well since everything else is so well maintained and nice. CONCLUSION. I would highly recommend this place without hestitation. If you are trying to save money, get your breakfast the night before or stroll out to a bakery. ps. a new exhibition at the just re-opened L'Orangerie (a smallish museum near the Louvre) of Monet's water lillys in the round is spectacular. if you are going to be in Paris for a few days, buy a Pass Musee, go past the lines at most museums...see this.) Carl

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, service lacking”
Reviews.Author: Mark_in_Chicago
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Royal Alma. Pros: Perfect location. Easy walk to the Champs Elysee or Eiffel Tower. Short walk to the Metro. Nice Cafes nearby. Clean room. Cons: Service -- First, I opened the door to my room and there was someone already occupying it. Second, I booked and paid for a higher level room with a king bed and was put in a lower level room with twins. They rectified this after the first night, and put us into a small suite to make up for the mistake. Not much to the common areas, and they reeked of smoke. (Though it is Paris, I guess.) We avoided the breakfast and headed out to the cafes as they were a better value. Overall, we had a wonderful time in Paris. The location made up for any minor inconveniences we experienced. The hotel is clean and has character, though it isn't luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFO_94109
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! Don't bother staying at this so called "boutique" hotel. There was absolutely nothing boutique about it at all. It was dirty, noisy, and cheap looking. Our stay went down hill the minute we walked into the lobby to check-in. First, the receptionist was collating personal documents of other guests (i.e. photocopies of passports, credit cards, etc.) at the front desk for all to see and perhaps steal. Throughout the entire check-in process, and with other random guests hovering around the front desk area she didn't think once to protect any of the personal guest information that she had strewn about the counter - she even walked away from the documents several times. Absolutely no security at all. And second, it took her several minutes to greet us and to even acknowlege us because she was too busy collating documents. The front lobby, common seating area w/bar, and dining area look like something out of a cheap motel rather than a 4-star "boutique" hotel. And there is no concierge, and reception was less than willing to dispense any tourist or restaurant information. The rooms are even worse. The first room we stayed in smelled heavy of cigarette smoke (although we specifically asked for a non-smoking room). The bathroom was not only disgustingly dirty but so small that you had to close the entry door in order to open the shower door. And the door stop for the bathroom was on the floor directly in front of the toilet so we kept tripping on it. The beds were 2 twins pushed together so we kept falling in between as we slept. The walls are paper thin so you can hear conversations, TV's, and bathroom noise from other guest rooms as if they were in your room with you. It was just awful. We asked to be moved to see if the problem with the noise was guest specific. It didn't help, the next room was just as bad - I actually had to purchase ears plugs in order to get any sleep. They do have double-paned windows but they were worthless - the windows might as well have been open. The hotel is on a one way street so you think it would be quiet. No, garbage and delivery trucks driveby in the early a.m. so the external noise is pretty bad if your room faces the street. Both rooms were equally bad. There were spider webs on the walls, carpets were stained, toilets were disgusting, shower was bad: water temp fluctuated and pressure was weak, beds were very hard and they gave you only one very long and hard pillow to share, linens are 2nd rate, no alarm clock, some light fixtures and phones did not work, furniture needs updating and steam cleaning, wall paper peeling up. And just to make our stay even worse, we found a playboy magazine in the room. And every morning, you can smell the cigarette smoke and food wafting up the stairwell and permeating throughout the halls and into the guest rooms. Please, do yourself a favor and stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and nothing special”
Reviews.Author: UK-CB4
Reviews.Content: I fail to see what's so "boutique" about this hotel. Boutique hotels usually have something special and different about them - this one is simply a (generally) comfortable hotel. We had a reasonable room - but the bathroom was a total disaster. The toilet was so jammed between the shower screen and the wall that I couldn't actually sit on it! Even for Paris that's quite an achievement - and a world first for me! The bath was also downright dangerous - neither my partner nor I were able to step into it without slipping or overbalancing. The room was comfortable - but it was not the non-smoking room the receptionist had assured us it would be - not with ashtrays and matches on the dek, and the small balcony littered with cigarette butts; it clearly hadn't been swept for weeks. Frankly, we dislike being lied to. The minibar prices were quite outrageous, and 25 Euros each for breakfast verges on extortion. On the Sunday morning, practically nothing was left (apart from the bacon swimming in grease). Staff were very unknowledgeable - they could only recommend one nearby restaurant (very ordinary) and could not answer simple "typical tourist" questions. In short - nothing special, overpirced, just one of a big chain - and absolutely not a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a quaint little hotel, situated just by the end of Avenue George V in walking distance to almost every location. The rooms were very nice and the service impeccable. I was there for part of my honeymoon and the staff went the extra mile to make us feel welcome and special. Although on 8 floors the hotel has a lovely marble staircase in the middle so, for all people averse to using a lift there is no need to climb the fire escape!! I would recommend this hotel to all who want a quiet boutique experience in the centre of Paris!

HotelInfo.Name: Melia Royal Alma Boutique Hotel
